response.ReviewTitle: The best place for chilling in Davao
response.Review: The place offers a wide variety of restaurants, bars, and night spots. The most popular is "Kanto" with a live band performance. Bands are rated and allows jamming and dancing. Wide variety of delicious pica picas and beers from all over. Smoking area at the parking area.
Good atmosphere. Plenty of food choices. Live music and beer what’s not to like. Many young people but a good atmosphere. Highly recommended

Coming here to the central big stage hall for live band performances on weekend. Great bands, great sound, great ambiance.  Lots of small bars/restaurants around with own designs and entertainment. bucket of beer is only P250 Always crowded.  You definitely will find something special up to your taste. If you using a taxi - better give small bills like P20 to the parking boys to get you a cab fast. Otherwise you will wait long especially on weekends.

Went to check out BLUGRE durian coffee and Aling Fopings halo halo. Well me and my daughter got the durian coffee and it was not that good to us, I like durian but not in coffee. The staff were nice and the place had great ac and was very clean. I would go back but next time I would get something else. The halo halo at aling fopings was just ok and you have to pick your toppings just make sure you get them we did not get all of ours. Would I go back may be but not for the halo halo.

response.ReviewTitle: Good place to eat and enjoy
response.Review: The place is very accessible, you can commute or drive your car. Lots of restaurant to choose. Good place to enjoy the music and food.
For those who want to enjoy the local dessert halohalo, try visiting Matina Town Square. You can create your own halohalo! The place is always very busy. Enjoy your visit!

I live near Matina Town Square. The reason I called it "haven gig" is because we come to this place in Davao City, Philippines as often as we could just to hang out.......So many restaurants to choose from....BUT a must try "halo-halo" from Aling Foping is to die for (not literally)........adults, kids, senior citizens...all these people are welcome❤️

Matina Town Square is very accessible and is easy to find. It's in front of Ateneo High School and is just walking distance from NCCC Mall. The place houses various restaurants and coffee shops and even offers some night life until midnight (since there's curfew in Davao). I recommend Taste of Home and Aloha Bar for dinner, and BluGre Coffee for the best Durian Coffee you can ever taste. :)
Lots of activities to do. Many places to eat. Nice and beautiful. Very accessible. Coffee shops to restaurants, fast food chains and bars. Really nice.
a lot of choice of food outlets from quiet restos to jumping bars. also a nice dessert place. HALO-HALO to your choice

response.ReviewTitle: You want to chill a little bit? Matina Time Square will give you that
response.Review: My bestfriend and I were just roaming around Davao for a day, looking for a place to eat so we ended up in MTS. Since my college days, I have been to MTS for how many times and for the span of 15 years, there's...More

MTS good place to have cheap and good food with great music. The Don band on sundays is a must. Check out the sizzling Bangus of the boss BBQ and the goat dishes of goats eye. The pork BBQ of boss is kinda disappointing. We...More

The place is full of restos and entertainment bars. It is very accessible and easy to find since it is just in front of Ateneo de Davao Grade school campus. We stayed at Blugre Cafe but you can hear and see the kind of night...More

response.ReviewTitle: Fun packed, with plenty of eating/drinking options
response.Review: Fun place to go at night time. The main band can be loud, but they were good. And there are several other bar options.

I had the pleasure to visit this place (KANTO) on Saturday night, 10 pm, I had my dinner (Boneless Grilled Chicken), listened to a nice life band including jazz 🎶 music. The food was great, reasonably price. Overall atmosphere was great.

response.ReviewTitle: Cool for tourists but very much same same
response.Review: A collection of restauants surrounding a center stage with live (very loud) music). Fun to viit if you are new to town but there is little istinction between eat of the restaunts in terms of food choice.
Saw a number of performances of great performers and great food and drinks. Put this one on your list to visit.
Is near a good sized mall. Went there and had a facial.Food is pretty cheep and the people are friendly. A place worth to visit
I love davao because there's no smoking and matina town square is fun though very dark too many mosquitoes, fun oldies music the last time we went, great time. i would go back!
Restaurants, Cafés, small stores. I don't understand why this should be an attraction. There is nothing special to buy or see.

response.ReviewTitle: Just an experience... Satuday night out!
response.Review: Be there earlier or you have a problem where to park your car. There are many younger people around, Good music and good food. Varied cuisine to choose from. I can bring friends next time around specially those that are inclined to love good music...More

response.ReviewTitle: Nice place to hang out for an evening, with everything you need.
response.Review: Basically, this is an area where people go to have fun in the evening. Fridays and Saturdays are busy, and if you are coming by car, parking can be a problem. There are loads of bars, and all kinds of unpretentious restaurants, many of which...More
i am always here with my friends late in the evening and have some chill music and drinks! the ambiance is nice too!
been there often,sometimes with friends,service is good as well as the food,calda pizza is yummy and so big,and my 1st tattoo was done there at redstar tattoo,at the 2nd floor

response.ReviewTitle: Good for night out with good company...
response.Review: Very accessible, just along the highway. Complete with boutique shops, a convenience store, coffee shops, juice bar, and a food court with varied food outlets and a stage for performers/bands.
Good place to have dinner if you visit Davao. Food is cheap and there are a lot of variety to order from.
Beer, food and music, enjoyed, live band playing, worth a visit, as there is not much night life in Davao........good pizza there
Varied food options. There is also a cafe that serves durian cake which is unique in Davao. A band also gives good music. A safe place that provides night life

response.ReviewTitle: A place to mingle with Dabawenyos
response.Review: A nice place to relax and mingle with Dabawenyos while listening to the oldies music. There are a lot of nice restaurants around but we chose the first one next to the stage on left side - I forgot the name but the food was...More

response.ReviewTitle: matina town square is a nice to hang out place
response.Review: MTS is a nice place and affordable place to hang out with friens. the shop with the famous halo halos is there. there is band and good music and the bars are very affordable
Night out with friends. Bands every night. There's a coffee shop that's been there like forever. Favorite is aling fopings,Serves best halo2x by far
Been here for 4 yrs. I actually like this place for chilling. Listening to music and hang out with friends. The food is delicious! I recommend this for tourist.
MTS is the place to be if you want to have a taste of Davao night life. I am a dabawenya and I'd say I go here almost every week not just to drink but also to eat. This is a nice place to meet...More

response.ReviewTitle: One of the best places to go in Davao if with friends and family!
response.Review: One of the best places to go to with friends and family. It has an area where a live band or a live group is entertaining the crowd. Adults usually go here for a few beers and good food. Families or groups of people who...More

I went here with my wife as we visit Davao and wanted some nightlife fun. We heard that MTS were a great place for such event and we took a taxi getting there. First of all, the accessability was great, you could grab a taxi,...More
This place is so accessible it just located near the highway and there are a lot of restaurants, bars and cafe located inside.
Very exciting venues for the nightout with family and friends. Diners and drinkers can choose the many food outlets and bars.
Went to MTS just to enjoy the food and music of live band. However, since the place is open, there are plenty of mosquitoes which is a let down. There are also stray cats.

MTS is the nightlife center of Davao City. Presence of men in uniform from the PNP abound to ensure safety of patrons of the place. Yes, a little bit of everything. Live band performers, restos that cater to varied palates and the popular Aling Poping's...More

A better place to spend at night passing the hour eating and drinking with friends, enjoying live bands. Coffee, beers, whiskey, tea, almost all drinks are served here so with pizzas to grilled dishes of your choice. Parking area is big. A must place to...More

response.ReviewTitle: Fondly Called Duterte Town Center Now!
response.Review: It is accepted fact now that these town center of the Philippines president-elect Rody Duterte is now fondly called after his last name. A Good entertainment area packed with bars and gastronomic pub, a trip to this area is a food trip on its own.

response.ReviewTitle: Listening to slow rock and roll music.
response.Review: This is one of the safest destination in Davao City when you, your family or friends want to chill. The only smoke you can smell is that coming from the grilled meats. Very relaxing ambiance with plenty of resto bars to choose from.
This place has a variety to see. Foods, drinks, music, dance if you like, and a perfect o,ace to meet up with friends
I came in a wrong time,there was a religious rally of some sort next door,lots of kids and loud noise blasting throughout the area,I stayed for about 45 minutes and left very disappointed.

My family and I would visit this place, often once a month and sometimes twice a month. It has a number of restaurants, food kiosks and other non-food shops. Prices are affordable and live/loud music is also played.
Great square of restaurants and cafes... Liveband performance adds to the energetic vibe where you will see good happy people
not for those who want peace and quiet...if you want a sensational night out, this place rocks! food is great and the place is very accessible.
This place is good and enjoyable to stay for gimmicks and to hangout with friends, for dining and drinking or just simply listen to music.

This has always been a great hangout place for both locals and tourists ! Theres a wide range of restos, bars that caters across various preferences. The sounds of different bands welcome you as you enter the compound. Prices are very very reasonable ! Gotta...More

response.ReviewTitle: Matina Town Square is Duterte Square
response.Review: I last visited the place early last December 2015, and it was full of life. Various bands and singing quarters rendered their own covers of local and internationally known songs. In this visit, I found out that a building is being erected nearby, this will...More
A Place to Have Fun. I often went here to release some Stress in Life :D Live Band Helps the Place more lively.

response.ReviewTitle: A few beers and snacks Filipino style
response.Review: Matina Town Square is an older 'entertainment centre' in Davao - I prefer the other one near Torres St. - it's more modern and laid back, but it's a fun place with live bands and a nice bar in the back owned by an English...More

response.ReviewTitle: Great Place To Hangout With Friends
response.Review: The place has open air restaurants. The best time for me to sit down, eat and enjoy the music is during night time. Stalls to buy stuffs and fast food restaurants and a coffee shop can also be found within the area. Enjoy!

My sis has read about the place and our cousin from Davao recommended it to us. We had dinner there on our last night but didn't get to hear or see any band play because of a power interruption which lasted for more or less...More
Had a couple of nice restaurants, midnight convenience store, location to get your Eden Natue park tickets

response.ReviewTitle: Very relaxing venue for night owls
response.Review: I lived near this place but dreaded going there because I thought it would be crawling with yuppies. How mistaken I have been! A friend of mine whom I had not seen for many many years suggested we go there - lo and behold, it...More
The Taboan is really great, has lots of choices for restaurants and the service is great. The only thing is that the music is so loud, I can't even hear my seatmate talking. Overall it's okay.
This is my favorite place to hangout when I was still studying. The place turns to a flea market on fridays and saturdays. But coffee shops and an open bar is what adds up to a great stay at MTS.

This is the place where you want to chill. Small Beer and Listen to Music :) Smoke Free Place DAVAO CITY 4th SAFEST PLACE IN THE WORLD POLICE ARE ALWAYS DOING THEIR ROUNDS! ARMY ARE ALWAYS ATTENTIVE Entrance, they have a check point/ walk ins...More

response.ReviewTitle: Nice place for gimmick with friends
response.Review: We kept coming back to this place. Lots of people come here specially Friday and Saturday. Parking is a real problem here, Nice festive atmosphere. Local bands play here. Recommended sa mga magbarkada

response.ReviewTitle: Really Wonderful Night Spot and not only for Yuppies
response.Review: For sooo long, I had been avoiding this place because my impression was that it was a yuppie haven. I could not have been more wrong. A long-time friend suggested we go there for a few beers and half way through my first San Miguel...More
There's a little place in the back that has the best halo-halo in the city in my opinion. It's pick your own toppings, too.

response.ReviewTitle: for a beer and a laugh the best place
response.Review: davao his mayor is very strict. so the nightlife is not so excisting in davao. This is one of the few places where you have lots of bars and restaurnts together. the restaurants are simple.the bars are good.lots of live music. lots of pretty women

Nice safe, cheap place to spend the night out no matter what day it is. Visited 3 different nights, bands, music, Zumba, a must see flame twirler, coffee shop, sweets shop, restaurants, complete place.
If you are looking for a place to chiill, relax and enjoy and you want music and drinks, this is the place for you.
Very practical public space with restaurants, pubs, massage centers, hairdressers, nightshops, 24/7 Mc Donald, Jellybee, toilets, a lot of atmosphere during weekends, with some live music.
This is a fun place has a good vibe that a lot of younger folks like. Go for the music and cheap eats. The place gets crowded in the evenings.

response.ReviewTitle: perfect for fish food lovers and BBQ
response.Review: super food, great atmosphere, a must during a davao visit , perfect for fish food lovers, best to go in big group

This is where most of the local band, visual artist, tattoo artist, indigenous culture and arts happen, Where you can Experience Joey Ayala, Jack in the box Davao band Jams with Popong Landero and Kaliwat Music mixed with indigenous culture and arts. Where everything is...More

response.ReviewTitle: Fun place for music and food
response.Review: Quite a fun plae to go to listen to some live music and have some food. The food could be better but the atmosphere is pretty cool there

Love the foods --- if you want pizza, burgers, ice cream, liquors, etc. you can have them all in MTS. Good place to go with on Saturday Nights. Good place to meet new friends and good place to bond with your friends and families.
went there during Kadayawan. had some great bands there. My husband even knew the musicians. reasonably priced drinks also

MTS has undergone a total makeover lately and still one of the destinations of Davao locals for a drink and party and of course food choices. Just opposite Ateneo de Davao gradeschoold and highschool, this place offers party, band, drinks and foods and cafe. But of course, dont forget the Davao city ordinance on curfew and smoking. Definitely MTS offers choices whether whatever time of the day and what you and your friends want.

When night comes and friends want to grab something to drink, this is the first choice that comes to mind. Expect that there will be lots of people but you will always find a place to sit... if you're lucky that is. Or just simply ask someone (a friend?) to reserve a spot. Either way, this is one of the many places you can go and hangout with the group... at night of course.

I had to double check the time when I went here cause for someone who came from a city where party starts at 12mn, this place surely suprises a lot. We arrived at around 8pm on a saturday night. there were already people drinking and bands playing. The place has an array of restaurants to choose from. It also has coffee shops and drinking places.   I love that people can only smoke at designated areas (which was actually the parking lot). The place is also safe. You can see police officers roaming around the place. Plus Davao observes a very strict curfew and strict rules on drinking.   Come here if you just wanna hang out,eat good food, hear music and laugh around with your friends! :)

different bands perform each night. there are restaurants, bars, even coffeeshops available in the area. I love aling Foping's! i dont know about other davaoenos but I love their halohalo. you are given the freedom to choose what ingredients you'd like to be added.

Liked the place especially because my husband love it so much.food and drinks are worthy of price.I'm not just fun of very loud music except if there's dance floor...overall was a great late night out.

That title sounds like a kill joy but the first thing my companions told me about this place was we ought to leave at 12 midnight. They have rules in Davao about curfew and the authorities impose it strictly.   It's a bustling place at night. I was able to do a lot of things like shopping, eating, and more eating. It's a good place to hang out to kill time but not to catch up with friends as it can get really noisy - as expected in party zones.   Word of advice: don't shop here if you're a tourist, unless you have nothing else to wear the next day.

densely populated zone in Davao... too many people out there that you have to be on extra precaution upon walking the sidewalk.. although people are well disciplined in this city but still not recommended to walk alone and not alert all the time.

Whether u want to dine, drink or be entertained, every night is a good night to visit MTS. We usually go there to have coffee at BluGre, enjoy dinakdakan and beer at Taboan, sample Black Burger at The Stairwell or savor Aling Foping's Halo Halo.

The place is a pot of flavors and eats, depending on the caterer that serves you, you'll get a variety of specialty dishes. Don't forget to eat as much durian as you can. There are places next to the chinese arch where you can sample the different varieties of Durian. Wear the plastic disposable gloves so you won't mess your fingers, and drink cold Coke. The combination of durian and Coke is WILD!!!
a place to party hard. a lot of choice on which poison you'd go for. parking lot is ample. i will definitely go to this place again ;)

Really nice place and a must see when you visit Davao, had a great time listening to the live music, cool and cheap beers..and a great pizza with good, friendly service at Bar and Belly. Lovely halo-halo at Aling F too. Enjoy.

Martina Town Square in south Davao City is a good alternative place for drinks and food but the place is rather hot during summer. We selected Barbeque Boss for food to go with our drinks. This pork barbeque is just like the satay from Malayisia...More

response.ReviewTitle: A Good Alternative to the Tribu K Mindanawan Show
response.Review: Since the Mindanawan cultural show is only available on friday and weekends, we decided to go to this attraction because of a scheduled performance of folk dance and music. The performers are students from the schools of Davao and nearby. We loved the music and...More

response.ReviewTitle: Just loved the feel of this place..
response.Review: Live bands, the people, food and booze.The best combination in the middle of Davao City.Very lively place and a fun place to be with friends or as a couple.Parking is a really messy affair though.

You drive to this place in search for a food fix and you get surprised with the choices, that's MTS. If you want beer and barbeque with live band playing, there are plentiful of choices in Taboan, and Jickong's is the locals' favorite. If you...More

We dine here one time. They have an open field on where you can walk around, like you're in a park. You will forget that you're actually at the heart of a city. There bands add to the calming feeling.. Great! You must try the...More

response.ReviewTitle: A place not only for people who enjoy nightlife
response.Review: This is a place boasting with shops, music, and more. Some of the shops here are open even during the day.

response.ReviewTitle: If you're looking for a place to go at night
response.Review: Most attractions close early, luckily MTS will be open pretty much all night. It's a good place for a chill, laid-back foodie experience, with live music and maybe a couple of drinks. Lots of food options, mostly affordable.

response.ReviewTitle: Absolutely the place to go to for nightlife
response.Review: Absolutely the place to go to for great food, atmosphere and brilliant live music! Food is very cheap and there's a variety of places to choose from. Live music is just an add on bonus to being in the place. Definitely worth a visit when you are in Davao.

MTS is the best place in Davao for fun, relaxing, good food, outdoor, a few drinks, life bands and much more - NOT ONLY for young people. Also for those people who want to feel young. When in Davao - MTS is a must!

Matina Town Square aka MTS, is a laid back place with a bunch of BBQ stalls around an open stage area where you can relax and listen to live music with a beer in one hand an a BBQ in the other. The crowd is mostly composed of teenagers and young adults who just want to bask in the open air and eat decently priced food while listening to live music. Besides the BBQ stalls, there are nearby fastfood joints like Jollibee and McDonald's. There are also some decent cafes, sweetshops, restaurants, arts and crafts stores, and travel shops around. On particular days they have mini bazaars where you can find bargain items and clothing.  The venue itself is well maintained. The toilets are properly working, the doors and roads are clean and functional. Security is also decent.  Try this place out during the weekend for more interesting sights or weekdays for a more relaxed vibe.
Fun relaxing place to hang out, drink a few beers and take in the show!! The bands are electic and the crowd is friendly.

Simply referred to as "MTS", this is a collection of mostly bars and simple diners. A lot of locals hang out here especially at night where it can be packed and parking will be hard to find. If going by taxi, no problem. The halo-halo place is popular and you choose what toppings you want on your halo-halo. It is yummy but it seems you pay more for what you get. Still worth to try. There is also an area that usually holds zumba classes which adds to the lively atmosphere. You can also find tour offices, salons and spas on the second floor. Overall an okay place where we go for an errand or particular food. Tourists may find nothing to really do here unless they want to just sit and hang out.

As a tourist, I did not find anything exciting about the Matina Square. I went at night on a weekday. There were lots of live bands playing. It was cool to see some kids break dancing off on their own.   Most people were just seated which made it seem like an average patio location.

Aside from the restaurants present in the area, there is also a zumba class during Monday to Thursday that starts at 6:30 pm and only costs 25 pesos per head. Not bad! There is also a massage parlor and a salon on the second floor.

response.ReviewTitle: A hang-out and so much more!
response.Review: I like going here in the afternoons, sitting (and/or reading) in one of the benches in the back. Lots of food choices too!

I like Matina Town Square, known to locals merely as "MTS" because it shows the soul of Davao. It is a complex of bars and restaurants, one of which has a live bands. Beer and Fingerfood "Pulutan" are the standard fare in this busy, fun place. This is also the place where smokers are assigned a smoking area, far away from the generally non-smoking Davawenos.

response.ReviewTitle: Still festive any day of the week
response.Review: new restaurants have flocked the square...more modern setup, with more services, shops and entertainment spots. guarded with security personnel.
Great place to be and be seen at night. Lots of food selections and nightly entertainment. If you're in Davao try to drop by this place.
I liked it better when it was grassy and open. Now its all covered by tents and it looks old and not well-maintained. Go there for Aling Foping's Halo-halo or the Tuesday night cultural performance.

When we were in Davao last Feb-Apr 2014 they were having a midnight curfew,everything can be open until 12 midnight only.We went to MTS several times at around 10pm & it was packed,nowhere to seat! Band is not good,you can only hear the drums &...More

Now considered as a family oriented destination in Davao City. their main attraction is Tabuan which features different bands, and the place is surrounded by different bars and grills. Also two of the most popular fastfoods are here: Jollibee and McDonalds

It was used to be a live wire of the city. When we were there we actually disappointed because the real beauty of the place has covered by giant food chain and grocery store. Can't even flush the toilets. It was used to be to...More

great place to hang out with your friends after a hard day at work or simply touring around..food establishments are numerous and varies w/ reasonable prices. outdoor entertainment by live bands is also an added attraction

response.ReviewTitle: Try Barbeque Boss and Blugre Cafe
response.Review: Sinuglaw is tasty delicious and cheap. They also have unlimited rice at P15. I like the Durian coffee experience.

response.ReviewTitle: Enjoyed a nice meal and local cultural performance!
response.Review: Enjoyed a wonderful evening with family eating local BBQ dishes and watching the performance of a local dance troupe performing cultural dances native to the area. Very nice smoke-free environment with plenty of dining and drinking choices. Primarily oriented towards the young adults but fun...More
Had a drink at Taboan. A designated smokers' area is accessible. Nice, in this smoke-free city. A band plays to entertain guests over beer or other alcoholic drinks. And lots of fingerfood choices.
It is very hot, noisy their basket ball court and poor gastronomie, to drink ok, but I really did not enjoy

I'm not really a drinker. My alcohol tolerance is very low, I easily get drunk and I dont like the smell and taste of alcohol so I alcoholic drinks is a big no no to me. But whenever I and my friends decides to have...More

response.ReviewTitle: A good place to hang out but a little old for my taste
response.Review: I love that I can find Blugre Coffee there. Too bad they don't have washroom inside the coffee. Because it's the only place I go to Matina for (and the convenience store). But Matina Town Square looks old for my taste.

response.ReviewTitle: A place where most people go for a night out
response.Review: MTS is like the only place in the city where people flock to drink and listen to the band while playing the music. Do not expect too much as there is nothing much to do here. During weekdays, the band plays boring music. Good venue...More

musical bands are playing nightly.. night bazaars almost every weekend.. a line of resto grills and bars to choose from.. and a child-friendly tiny park for familes with children.. place is secured too
Matina Town Square is being renovated at the moment so difficult to say much about it. From what I saw it looks a lively night spot with bars and eating places. Will be good when it's finnished.
just for the people who love partying and being drunk all night, its not really a classy place, most are trouble makers

A cool place to dine out with friends, lots of different food styles and a nice band playing. Go early cause they stop sooner than on other islands (around 1:30am). If you want conversation find a table in the back. If you're a smoker be...More

We went here at around 11PM to relax after our strenuous itinerary. I just want to drink a couple of beers and eat some local food. There's a live band playing. It's ambiance is similar to Central of Manila. After we ate our dinner at around 15 past midnight, we ordered 2 buckets of beers. At 1AM, the band stopped playing and some restos closing. At 1:45AM, you can only imagine how my friends reacted when they started to turn off all the lamp posts. I'm indifferent but my friends were so pissed off. The following day, we decided to hit the place at around 7PM. By the way, they only have one smoking area so be prepared for a little inconvenience.
good food but quite noisy for me , maybe i just dont like the bands playing when we visit
MTS is a very small and compact commercial area. Head for the back where a Foping's (not sure about the spelling) cart sells halo halo and bibingka. Generous and delicious ingredients. Yummy!

I always hang out in MTS. Barbeque Boss serves cheap but delicious barbeque. Beers are served ice-cold always.  Whistletop is also nice. Although service crew is a little slow at times.  Bazaars are seen on Fridays. Pre-loved stuff and other products.  A good place to chill with friends!

As a tourist destination, it's not much. Just a playground for the kids (although mine really loved it), a few shops and several restaurants. However, as a place to hang out, eat bbq, have a couple of beers and watch some local bands, it is ideal. I think MTS is better appreciated if you are a local, or if you've been to Davao many times and just want to hang out someplace to unwind. Or, if there is a special event like during Kadayawan.
from jazz, to acoustic, reggae, pop, ballads, rock, new wave etc. you name it they do have it, just be aware of the days where each genre is being played

Abreeza Mall is a convenient place to shop and eat when staying at Seda Hotel in JP Laurel, Davao City. It is right across the hotel. There are a number of restaurants to choose from for lunch and dinner- fastfoods, regular dine-in e.g, Japanese (Sumosan), Shakey’s, Jollibee, Yellow Cab, For snacks and coffee, you can go to Starbuck’s , J.Company , Dunkin Donuts or one of the food stalls/carts like Fruits in Ice Cream, etc. Most of the shops are those found in Manila. Foreign brands are present - Mango, Esprit, Gap, Giordano, Charles & Keith, Hush Puppies, H&M, etc. A few interesting local brands are available like Chimes, Cocoon (nice formal wear at reasonable prices), Just G (for tweens and teens), Mendez. There are gadget shops on the upper floor. There is also a Robinson’s Dept Store (poor rating for me) and a Robinson’s Supermarket (good rating for me). If you just want to stroll around, mall is ok but if you want to shop, try other malls.
A great mall with all kinds of products westerners are used to seeing. Very good choice of restaurants and the prices are excellent too.

This mall has everything. From the medium luxury to basic , you can find it here. Movie theatres , salons , department stores , fast food and restaurants. Security was tight too . Being very near to Seda Hotel , it made my stay convenient and worth it. The Ayala seal of high quality is very evident in this mall .
- Branded accessories to choose from men's, women's and kids - best cinemas - fantastic restaurants you can choose from seafood, meat, pasta - coffee shops are great - spacious mall
Located in a straight line with 3 other malls. It's conveniently located in the centre of Davao and has shops for everything and everyone! It's a one stop mall with a hotel attached (Seda Hotel).

A little confusing to get into but it is very secure even for Grab. Security checks the trunk before you arrive at the drop off point. When you are done shopping the many shops, there is a central point where they will help you with your cab or grab ride.

response.ReviewTitle: Expanded and improved Ayala Mall in the South
response.Review: We enjoyed dining, shopping and having some entertainment in this new expanded and improved Ayala Abreeza Mall in Davao. We saw some shows and some features aside from the usual one does in the mall. Shops and restaurants range from local brands to international chains.

response.ReviewTitle: Great mall to dine, shop, and relax when in Davao

When in Davao, Abreeza Mall is the best place to do this because, not only is it big and with fantastic architecture, it melds greens and open spaces into the space to cloak shoppers in an even more relaxing vibe. Tourists can also shop for locally made food products and goods at the outdoor Asian Fruit Market and at Davao Dwellings at the 3F.

Just infront of Redemptorist church. Very nice mall, not that spacious compared to manila malls or even with sm lanang premier... But it serves the people well.  Places to eat? They got many... moon cake, grab a crab, etc... Depending on your food trip and budget.  Parking? Average... Did not experience the hassle of finding parking spaces here.  What I do not do here? Groceries... A bit pricey compared to Gmall and VP.

On the 3rd leve; outer part of the mall there are a handful of restos and fastfood area over-looking Davao City. You can feel the cool air breeze. Situated in the ground floor level are the famous fast food chains that we see in Manila

response.ReviewTitle: It's a tasty cookie-cutter Ayala Mall - down South
response.Review: It sits along a main street where several other malls are located and it is considered the queen among many. If not for the Davao-borne establishments (Tsuru, for one), any mall rat would swear they are either in Glorietta, Trinoma, Ayala Center in Cebu or...More
I feel like I am not away from Manila. :). I is like I just in Manila. Except for some stall are stores here In Davao. :)

The Abreeza Mall covers a lot of your needs in a calm, air conditioned area. We were enjoying our Frappocinos at Startbucks. Great to either sit out or inside.   The dermatology clinic Belo is a great experience, and accomodated us even if we where late.   They offer many cash withdrawal machines (ATM's), luckily because many of them was out of order or did not serve interantional cards(?)   Even going to the toilet area is a pleasant experience. Clean, well maintained by a great staff!

Being an Ayala mall, the design resembles like Trinoma in Quezon City, the design is huge and somehow circular and rectangular which can make you lost or tired due to distance. Many of the stores in Abreeza are not available in Manila.

Abreeza Mall is my favorite place to be when I am hungry, when I need to check on some stuff, find some books, pass the time, take my favorite cup of chai tea latte from coffeee bean, catch up with friends and so on....

response.ReviewTitle: Abreeza Mall The Upscale Mall in Davao
response.Review: Abreeza Mall is part of the Ayala Malls chain nationwide and if you say Ayala Malls you expect upscale high end brands for the local market.  Abreeza Mall did not disappoint the delicate taste of Davaoeños. It provided them a haven for shopping and dining pleasure. Some brands are even ahead in Abreeza than Ayala Center Cebu which is considered the shopping mecca of the south.   When in Davao, its a must to visit Abreeza Mall.

Of the many malls in Davao City, I frequent the Abreeza mall. Aside from being accessible from home, I go there to relax, see many free activities, exhibits and shows at the atrium. Going to the movies is very convenient and hustle free because of pre assigned seats which could be bought on line or way ahead of time. Usually , when I have nothing to do after my early grocery shopping at Robinsons Supermarket at the the first floor, I while away my time choosing movies to see, order my popcorn and lemonade at TATERS to be delivered to me inside the cinema. There are also fruits in season sold at the foodcourt right besides Taters. There are many shops selling branded clothing and shoes which where once found only in Manila like Mango, M n S, Debenhaus, Dorothy Perkins, Payless, Aldo, Naturalizer, and rows of restaurants at the first, second, and third floor. My grandchildren enjoys playing at the mall covered playground, driving electric cars and riding the electric train. I have eaten in almost all the restaurants in this mall such as Antonio's, Dong Juan, Chikaan, Hukad,Somosan, Shakey's, Sunburst, Chowking, Mang Inasal, J.Co, Army Navy, The Coffee Bean, Italliannis. TGIF, to name a few. Every thursday night the mall offers free zumba class. Fully Booked and National Book Store, as well as Book on Sales are my sources of magazines and books. Abreeza has almost everything to cater our family needs. Many uniformed guards roam around to help secure the mall. These guards are approachable, polite and helpful. Their visibility around the mall makes me feel secure. In front of Robinson Dept Store is a terminal for registered buses and vans coming and going to nearby cities and towns.   There are 4 things in Abreeza that make it stand above the rest of the malls :  1. The 2 rocking chairs for the senior citizens called SILYA.  2. The use of Family Lounge free to senior citizens.   3. The many clean toilets and the free toilet papers that that seem not to run out of supply. This sprawling 3 story mall has at least 3 toilets stations ( male , female, Pwd) with many cubicles in every floor.   4. This is the only mall that has a valet service.
I felt like I'm transported back in the states with all the familiar shops,it's a nice place to cool down and get away from the heat.

I always go here to buy groceries, shop, eat out with friends/family or just relax. IMO, this is the only mall in Davao so far that has almost everything a mall rat, fashionista, tourist or businessman would like. You've got a variety of dining options here for the budget conscious, middle class or a high roller. The shops are also varied enough for every budget. One good thing about this mall is also it's open area at the top level where various restaurants with rightly priced food are located. They also have an area for kids in the atrium.

response.Review: An Ayala Mall.   The Ayala brand is there. Warm welcome, professional security staff, pleasing and accommodating concierge personnel, and of course the wide and spacious mall.   You can find the best brands here. Ideal place for shopping. Everything you need is here. The mall is accessible via public transportation.

you can not get a better price for your tourist buck than here. you an even haggle it down from the all ready lowest price.lots of little shops packed together carrying the same stuff like t-shirt shops but there are even furniture shops here. everybody wants your business here so look around then go back to the shop you like the most if they do not have it they might send somebody to go get it from another family member work on other side.

Abreeza Mall is one of the two more "upscale" malls in Davao and offers, at least from my point of view, the best shopping experience in the city for those interested in brand name merchandise. It's got lots of "designer" stores familiar in the west, including Tommy Hilfiger, Armani Exchange, the Gap, Guess, Nine West, and some others that can't be found elsewhere in the city.   The mall was built by Ayala, one of the largest developers in the Makati area of Manila and the design expertise of that group is evident in the overall attractiveness of the mall, which is a bit more interesting than the concrete boxes more typical of the mall genre in Davao. Though it's not nearly as interesting nor as sophisticated as Greenbelt in Makati--perhaps Ayala's best known shopping project--it is the most elegant experience that Davao has to offer, and it does provide a clean, attractive ambience in which to shop. Underground parking is abundant and easily accessible and all floors can be accessed via a glass elevator or escalators.   Though the mall offers a number of restaurants catering to a broad range of tastes, it does not feature any of the higher end, intimate restaurants characteristic of Greenbelt, nor does it have the green, landscaped open areas of the latter. Nonetheless, the mall is a viable, welcome addition to the city.
If you want to get all your shopping done in one place then this is a nice AC place to do so. Mall prices tend to be slightly higher than elsewhere in the city, but not prohibitively so.
